text: Nick Holonyak Jr. (November 3, 1928 - September 18, 2022) was an American engineer and educator. He is known for his 1962 invention of a light-emitting diode (LED). He was a John Bardeen Endowed Chair Emeritus in Electrical and Computer Engineering and Physics at the University of Illinois at Urbana- Champaign. Holonyak died on September 18, 2022 in Urbana, Illinois at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2022 deaths Category:University of Illinois faculty Category:Engineers from Illinois Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from Illinois
title: Nick Holonyak
